Dispute_Type: Application refusal based on spousal ineligibility
Legal_Issue: Whether the Appeal Division incorrectly placed the burden of proof on the visa officer regarding intent to reside permanently
Credibility_Assessment: Focus on husband's belief rather than applicant's intent
Evidence_Type: Opinions from wife's cousin and husband, lack of concrete evidence
Basis_of_Claim: Marriage entered primarily for immigration purposes
Evaluation_Standard: Intent to reside permanently with spouse
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Applicant's genuine intent to cohabit permanently
Application_Error: Misapprehension of evidence, improper focus on third-party beliefs
Review_Outcome: Decision set aside, remanded for reconsideration
Assessment_Standard: Objective evidence of permanent residence intent
Evidence_Ignored: Lack of direct evidence of wife's intent
Legal_Standard: Burden of proof on sponsored applicant under s. 4(3)
Decision_Review_Issue: Incorrect allocation of burden of proof
Cause_of_Refusal: Suspected lack of intent to reside permanently with spouse
Evidentiary_Issues: Reliance on opinions rather than factual evidence
Procedural_Fairness: Improper application of burden of proof
Credibility_Issues: Questionable demonstration of genuine marital intent

Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Immigration Regulations
Omission_Type: Failure to assess applicant's own conduct and statements
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Inadmissibility under s. 4(3) due to suspected immigration fraud
